body: @ncw @animosity22  I would be interested to give this a try, but I haven't developed in Go besides the official tutorial. Would that work out?

I can assure you I cannot develop much at all so that would be fine.

@ncw is a superb explainer and helper in terms of helping you along if you want to pick it up and have a go at it.

I think that might have to wait a little longer. The api on their page seems to be very early and incomplete and doesn't quite provide the minimum feature-set we usually want to have for rclone. (e.g. right now there seems to be no support for folders at all).

(Also unlimited storage for free kinda is an unusual business model... I can't see that site living for long)
@buengese that's true and one of the reasons I jumped in. Although it's very incipient, it could help serve as an entry-level implementation or would you recommend something else?

folder support seems to have been added, anyone interested in giving it a go now?

(and that it has survived two years now)
Any update on this? File storage seems promising, despite the "storage duration" limitations

> Any update on this? File storage seems promising, despite the "storage duration" limitations

Unless you plan to:

1) submit a PR
2) have someone else that can do a PR
3) plan to sponsor it

It'll not have an update as it's in the new remote backlog with very little interest..
What's the status on this provider? Just recently came across this issue and noticed that @ncw has already started working on it. If help is still needed, I'm interested in contributing :)
@samuelchristlie it is in development. I will post a beta when it is ready for testing
